# Definition for singly-linked list.
# class ListNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.next = next
class Solution:
    def isPalindrome(self, head: ListNode) -> bool:
        q = []

        if not head:
            return True

        node = head
        # ë¦¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸ ë³€í™˜
        while node is not None:
            q.append(node.val)
            node = node.next

        # íŒ°ë¦°ë“œë¡¬ íŒë³„
        while len(q) > 1:
            if q.pop(0) != q.pop():
                return False

        return True

í’€ì´ 2 - ë°í¬ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•œ ìµœì í™”

# Definition for singly-linked list.
# class ListNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.next = next
class Solution:
    def isPalindrome(self, head: ListNode) -> bool:
        q = collections.deque()

        if not head:
            return True

        node = head
        # ë¦¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸ ë³€í™˜
        while node is not None:
            q.append(node.val)
            node = node.next

        # íŒ°ë¦°ë“œë¡¬ íŒë³„
        while len(q) > 1:
            if q.popleft() != q.pop():
                return False

        return True

í’€ì´ 3 - ëŸ°ë„ˆë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•œ í’€ì´

# Definition for singly-linked list.
# class ListNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.next = next
class Solution:
    def isPalindrome(self, head: ListNode) -> bool:
        rev = None
        slow = fast = head
        # ëŸ°ë„ˆë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ ì—­ìˆœ ì—°ê²° ë¦¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸ êµ¬ì„±
        while fast and fast.next:
            fast = fast.next.next
            rev, rev.next, slow = slow, rev, slow.next
        if fast:
            slow = slow.next
            
		# íŒ°ë¦°ë“œë¡¬ ì—¬ë¶€ í™•ì¸
        while rev and rev.val == slow.val:
            slow, rev = slow.next, rev.next
        return not rev

class Node:
    # ì´ˆê¸°í™” í•¨ìˆ˜ 
    def __init__(self, item, next):
        self.item = item
        self.next = next

class Stack:
    def __init__(self):
        self.last = None

    def push(self, item):
        self.last = Node(item, self.last)
    
    def pop(self):
        item = self.last.item
        self.last = self.last.next
        return item

stack = Stack()
stack.push(1)
stack.push(2)
stack.push(3)
stack.push(4)
stack.push(5)

for _ in range(5):
    print(stack.pop())

ë¬¸ì œ - ìœ ìš”í•œ ê´„í˜¸

ê´„í˜¸ë¡œ ëœ ì…ë ¥ê°’ì´ ì˜¬ë°”ë¥¸ì§€ íŒë³„í•˜ë¼.

def isValid(s):
    stack = []
    table = {
        ')' : '(',
        '}' : '{',
        ']' : '[',
    }
    # ìŠ¤íƒ ì´ìš© ì˜ˆì™¸ ì²˜ë¦¬ ë° ì¼ì¹˜ ì—¬ë¶€ íŒë³„
    for char in s:
        if char not in table:
            stack.append(char)
        elif not stack or table[char] != stack.pop():
            return False
    
        
    return len(stack) == 0

print(isValid('()[]{}'))

ë¬¸ì œ -

def removeDuplicateLetters(s):
    # ì§‘í•©ìœ¼ë¡œ ì •ë ¬
    for char in sorted(set(s)):
        suffix = s[s.index(char):]
        
        # ì „ì²´ ì§‘í•©ê³¼ ì ‘ë¯¸ì‚¬ ì§‘í•©ì´ ì¼ì¹˜í•  ë•Œ ë¶„ë¦¬ ì§€í–‰
        if set(s) == set(suffix):
            return char + removeDuplicateLetters(suffix.replace(char, ''))
    return ''

print(removeDuplicateLetters('bcabc'))

ë¬¸ì œ - ì›í˜• í ë””ìì¸

class MyCircularQueue:
    
    def __init__(self, k):
        self.q = [None] * k
        self.maxlen = k
        self.p1 = 0
        self.p2 = 0

    # rear í¬ì¸í„° ì•ìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ë™
    def enQueue(self, value):
        if self.q[self.p2] is None:
            self.q[self.p2] = value
            self.p2 = (self.p2 + 1) % self.maxlen
            return True
        else:
            return False

    # front í¬ì¸í„° ì•ìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ë™
    def deQueue(self):
        if self.q[self.p1] is None:
            return False
        else:
            self.q[self.p1] = None
            self.p1 = (self.p1 + 1) % self.maxlen
            return True

    def Front(self):
        return -1 if self.q[self.p1] is None else self.q[self.p1]

    def Rear(self):
        return -1 if self.q[self.p2 - 1] is None else self.q[self.p2 - 1]

    def isEmpty(self):
        return self.p1 == self.p2 and self.q[self.p1] is None

    def isFull(self):
        return self.p1 == self.p2 and self.q[self.p1] is not None

myCircularQueue = MyCircularQueue(3);
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(1)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(2)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(3)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(4)); # return False
print(myCircularQueue.Rear());     # return 3
print(myCircularQueue.isFull());   # return True
print(myCircularQueue.deQueue());  # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(4)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.Rear());     # return 4

[ë¦¬íŠ¸ì½”ë“œ] - í êµ¬í˜„

class MyCircularQueue:
    
    def __init__(self, k):
        self.q = [None] * k
        self.maxlen = k
        self.p1 = 0
        self.p2 = 0

    # rear í¬ì¸í„° ì•ìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ë™
    def enQueue(self, value):
        if self.q[self.p2] is None:
            self.q[self.p2] = value
            self.p2 = (self.p2 + 1) % self.maxlen
            return True
        else:
            return False

    # front í¬ì¸í„° ì•ìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ë™
    def deQueue(self):
        if self.q[self.p1] is None:
            return False
        else:
            self.q[self.p1] = None
            self.p1 = (self.p1 + 1) % self.maxlen 
            return True

    def Front(self):
        return -1 if self.q[self.p1] is None else self.q[self.p1]

    def Rear(self):
        return -1 if self.q[self.p2 - 1] is None else self.q[self.p2 - 1]

    def isEmpty(self):
        return self.p1 == self.p2 and self.q[self.p1] is None

    def isFull(self):
        return self.p1 == self.p2 and self.q[self.p1] is not None

myCircularQueue = MyCircularQueue(3);
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(1)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(2)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(3)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(4)); # return False
print(myCircularQueue.Rear());     # return 3
print(myCircularQueue.isFull());   # return True
print(myCircularQueue.deQueue());  # return True
print(myCircularQueue.enQueue(4)); # return True
print(myCircularQueue.Rear());     # return 4



from random import randint
import time

arr = []
for _ in range(10000):
    arr.append(randint(1, 100))

# ì„ íƒ ì •ë ¬ ì‹œê°„ ì¸¡ì •
start_time = time.time()

# ì„ íƒ ì •ë ¬
for i in range(len(arr)):
    min_index = i # ê°€ì¥ ì‘ì€ ì¸ë±ìŠ¤
    for j in range(i + 1, len(arr)):
        if arr[min_index] > arr[j]:
            min_index = j
    arr[i], arr[min_index] = arr[min_index], arr[i]  # swap

end_time = time.time()
print('ì„ íƒ ì •ë ¬ ì„±ëŠ¥ ì¸¡ì •', end_time - start_time)

start_time = time.time()
arr.sort()
end_time = time.time()
print('ê¸°ë³¸ì •ë ¬', end_time - start_time)
